turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Shylock.
turn.1: What does Shylock have to do with the Praetorian gang?
turn.2: Shylock is then ordered to surrender half of his wealth and property to the state and the other half to Antonio.
turn.3: Is he able to do so?
turn.4: However, as an act of "mercy", Antonio modifies the verdict, asking Shylock to hand over only one-half of his wealth – to him (Antonio) for his own as well as Lorenzo's need – provided that he keeps two promises.
turn.6: First, Shylock has to sign an agreement bequeathing all his remaining property to Lorenzo and Jessica, which is to become effective after his demise, and second, he is to immediately convert to Christianity.
turn.8: Shylock is forced to agree to these terms, and he exits citing illness.
turn.9: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.10: In Shakespeare's time, no Jews had been legally present in England for several hundred years (since the Edict of Expulsion in 1290).
turn.11: Why were they not allowed to resettle?
turn.12: However, stereotypes of Jews as money lenders remained from the Middle Ages.
